content:
Nice clash, but the statement is a bit confusing.
It doesn't help that the first test makes it seem like the average is across each row color-wise. You get a pass on that test if you solve it that way.

i.e.
[(255+0+0)/3, (0+255+0)/3, (0+0+255)]
[(255+255+255/3)]x3
[(255+255+0)/3,(0+255+255)/3,(255+0+255)/3]

Maybe it's just me though.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Again, pretty fun shortest mode clash; you have to test multiple ideas out

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: In my opinion, the task well reflects the situation of real application. Not very difficult, but incredibly useful

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: lgtm.

I got down to 96 bytes using exec() tricks and print(*[], sep=";")
Also, your shortest code doesn't work anymore. I assume you made it when you first made the clash and haven't updated it.

Input section
* Please change "Line 2 and more" to "Next [[s]] lines".

* Please format "line" and "color" as [[variables]].

* Please mention color is an integer.

Input and Output section
* Please format ";" and "," as {{constants}} instead of [[variables]].

* As the statement mentions that ";" is used to separate the pixels only, is it possible to remove ";" at the end of each input/output line?

Constraints section
* Please change "lines" to "line" for consistency.

* Please add "length of" in front of "line".

* Please change 2 to 6 (or 7 if each line still ends with a comma) because each pixel cannot be shorter than that.

Stub generator
* Please change "n" to "s" for consistency.

* Please change "R" to "line" for consistency.

Thanks.
Do not hesitate to correct any spelling/phrasing issue as I'm not native english speaker

Thanks for your approval !

Exactly, I updated it with your tips but did not get down to 96, still 6 bytes higher.

Thank you for making the changes. Just a few more points:

Input section
* Please move "color is an integer" to the end of the section.

Output section
* Please format ; as a {{constant}} instead of a [[variable]].

Constraints section
* Please change [[length of line]] to length of [[line]].

* Please change 6 to 5 (I'm sorry, I counted it wrong).

Thanks again.

I could have guessed this points, sorry.
Thanks again !
